items.title: [Metafilter] Hint Line '93
items.content_html: Yarn Spinner built a 90s game hint-line simulator for ACMI in which you play a recently hired call center employee with an incomplete binder of maps and hints left by other workers. If you can't make it to the museum in Melbourne there is also an online version, although you will miss out on the handcrafted details of the exhibit, like the fake cubicle with a dead plant, demotivational posters, and the binder itself with all of its hand written post-it notes.
items.summary: Yarn Spinner built a 90s game hint-line simulator for ACMI in which you play a recently hired call center employee with an incomplete binder of maps and hints left by other workers. If you can't make it to the museum in Melbourne there is also an online version, although you will miss out on the handcrafted details of the exhibit, like the fake cubicle with a dead plant, demotivational posters, and the binder itself with all of its hand written post-it notes.

_source.original_title: Hint Line '93

items.title: [Boing Boing] California orders Musk's xAI to stop generating sexual deepfakes immediately
items.content_html:
California Attorney General Rob Bonta sent a cease and desist letter to xAI ordering Elon Musk's company to stop creating and distributing nonconsensual sexual images, CalMatters reports. The letter cited "numerous examples of xAI taking ordinary, clothed images of women and children" and allowing users "to depict the people in suggestive and sexually explicit scenarios and 'undress' them, all without the subjects' knowledge or consent." — Read the rest

The post California orders Musk's xAI to stop generating sexual deepfakes immediately appeared first on Boing Boing.

items.title: [Boing Boing] Museum exhibits a simulated 1993 Game Hint phone line
items.content_html:
If GameFAQs is past its prime and its contents devoured whole by the LLMs, it remains a wonder of the web. Thanks to it, a generation of gamers never needed human help to overcome their hurdles. And they certainly didn't need to make a phone call to an expensive tip line, the pre-internet status quo that Jeff Veasey disrupted when he founded the site in 1995. — Read the rest

The post Museum exhibits a simulated 1993 Game Hint phone line appeared first on Boing Boing.
